sub_topic: Preparation of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid from benzoic acid and chlorine gas
message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the preparation of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid from benzoic acid and chlorine gas? Also, calculate the theoretical yield of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid if starting with 10 grams of benzoic acid and excess chlorine gas, assuming a 90% yield.
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the preparation of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid from benzoic acid and chlorine gas is:

C7H6O2 + 2 Cl2 → C7H4Cl2O2

To calculate the theoretical yield, we first need to determine the molar mass of benzoic acid (C7H6O2) and 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid (C7H4Cl2O2).

Molar mass of benzoic acid (C7H6O2) = (7 × 12.01) + (6 × 1.01) + (2 × 16.00) = 122.12 g/mol
Molar mass of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid (C7H4Cl2O2) = (7 × 12.01) + (4 × 1.01) + (2 × 35.45) + (2 × 16.00) = 191.02 g/mol

Now, we can calculate the moles of benzoic acid used:

moles of benzoic acid = mass / molar mass = 10 g / 122.12 g/mol = 0.0819 mol

Since the reaction has a 1:1 stoichiometry, the moles of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid produced will be the same as the moles of benzoic acid used:

moles of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid = 0.0819 mol

Now, we can calculate the theoretical mass of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid produced:

mass of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid = moles × molar mass = 0.0819 mol × 191.02 g/mol = 15.64 g

Finally, we can calculate the actual yield, assuming a 90% yield:

actual yield = theoretical yield × percentage yield = 15.64 g × 0.90 = 14.08 g

So, the theoretical yield of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid is 14.08 grams, assuming a 90% yield.
